title: Epstein survivors name landmark bill after Virginia Giuffre | ABC NEWS
description: Survivors of late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have announced a new bill named after his most prominent accuser, Australian Virginia Giuffre. 'Virginia's Law' removes the time limit for survivors of sexual abuse to file civil claims. It comes as a newly uncovered FBI interview raises fresh questions about what Donald Trump knew about Epstein's crimes and when. title: Dawson's Creek star James Van Der Beek dies | ABC NEWS
description: James Van Der Beek, the American actor best known for his starring role as Dawson Leery in Dawson's Creek from 1998 to 2003, has died at the age of 48. He was diagnosed with colorectal cancer in 2023. title: Liberals call for leadership spill after wave of frontbench resignations | ABC NEWS
description: Two Liberal MPs have requested a spill after the resignation of a wave of frontbenchers, including Angus Taylor who is expected to challenge for the party's leadership. Political Lead David Speers say there are two distinct camps within the party, with some saying Sussan Ley has not been given a fair go, while the other camp says the party faces an existential threat. title: US strike on Iran more likely than not: Lyons | ABC NEWS
description: US President Donald Trump has met with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at the White House to discuss the ongoing nuclear talks with Iran. It comes amid rising tensions in the Middle East with the US deploying military aircrafts into the region. Americas Editor John Lyons says it’s becoming “more likely than not” the US will launch strikes on Iran, specifically targetting the Revolutionary Guard. title: Canadian school shooter identified as 18-year-old Jesse Van Rootselaar | ABC NEWS
description: The person who carried out a school massacre in remote British Columbia has been identified as 18-year-old woman Jesse Van Rootselaar. Police also revised the death toll down to nine from the initially reported 10, including the shooter, who died by suicide. Canadian prime minister Mark Carney has delayed a trip to a Munich security conference and ordered flags on government buildings to be flown at half-mast. title: Listen to the remarkable Triple Zero call of 13yo boy who swam 4km to save his family | ABC NEWS
description: The critical Triple Zero (000) call made by 13-year-old Austin Appelbee to alert authorities after he and his family were swept out to sea south of Perth has been released. In a calm voice, Austin explains to the operator his family are "kilometres out to sea" and his mother has asked him to fetch help. title: Belgian tourist Celine Cremer's car key, more bones found in riverbed search | ABC NEWS
description: A search party of police and paramedics has found more bones and a Honda car key, which has been "formally verified" as having belonged to missing tourist Celine Cremer.  Ms Cremer, 31, was backpacking in Tasmania in June 2023 when she went missing after embarking on a short hike to Philosopher Falls, in the state's north-west wilderness. title: Milano-Cortina: 'I'm bummed' Jakara Anthony misses moguls medals
description: Reigning Olympic champion Jakara Anthony finished last in the moguls super-final in her pursuit to become the first Australian to defend a Winter Olympic title. In more positive news, Scotty James looks locked in as he chases an elusive Olympic gold in the snowboard half pipe. The men's ice hockey is underway and this year is well worth watching, the NHL players are back.    Featured: Simon Smale, ABC SPORT. Arpon Basu, NHL writer, The Athletic.    Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)

description: Security forces are on high alert in Bangladesh as more than 100 million people are expected to cast their votes in a crucial national election. title: Missing Tasmanian man separated from friend while collecting firewood, police say | ABC NEWS
description: A 32-year-old man missing in Tasmania's north was collecting firewood with a friend when the pair became separated on Sunday, police have said.  Longford man Corey Chugg was reported missing to Tasmania Police on Monday afternoon by a friend, about 24 hours after he had last seen him.  Mr Chugg has not been seen since. title: What's motivating NATO's Arctic Sentry? | ABC NEWS
description: NATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte has announced a new NATO military effort called Arctic Sentry.   Jim Townsend from the Centre for a New American Security explains the surveillance initiative will bolster patrols of the Arctic, particularly around Greenland. The initiative also comes as Russia and China take a greater interest in the Arctic with the seasonal Northern Sea Route. It's expected to open up global trade between Asia and Europe. title: Visibly upset Mark Carney speaks after Canada mass shooting | ABC NEWS
description: A visibly upset Prime Minister Mark Carney promised Canadians would get through what he called a "terrible" mass shooting at a school in British Columbia.  Nine people were killed, including the alleged shooter, in one of the deadliest mass casualty events in recent Canadian history and the deadliest shooting in Canada since 2020.  Canadian police have identified the person who carried out a school massacre as an 18-year-old woman with mental health issues.
